name: Geotechnical and Geoenvironmental Engineering
descrp: Soil formation and identification. Engineering properties of soils. Fundamental aspects of soils, including soil mineralogy, soil-water movement, effective stress, consolidation, and soil strength. Geosynthetics and material interface properties. The use of soils and geosynthetics in geotechnical and geoenvironmental applications. Site investigation techniques. Laboratory testing and evaluation of soil composition and properties.
